title: Convert app to frontend-only static site for Netlify (remove IC backend & Internet Identity)

requirements.text: Convert the project into a frontend-only, fully static React/Vite site suitable for Netlify deployment by removing the Internet Computer backend canister code and IC-specific build/deploy configuration from the repo.

quotes: ok make my project to frontend only so i can deploy it to netlify
make my code static and netlify freindly

acceptanceCriteria: The `backend/` canister code is removed from the build/deploy flow (no backend canister is required to run or deploy the site).
IC/dfx-specific deployment configuration is removed or clearly separated so a Netlify deploy can run without installing/using dfx.
A clean Netlify build completes successfully using only the frontend build output (no backend artifacts required).

requirements.text: Remove Internet Identity and backend actor usage from the runtime by switching the app entrypoint to a new static-only bootstrap file without editing any frontend immutable paths (do not edit `frontend/src/main.tsx` or the immutable II/actor hooks files).

quotes: ok make my project to frontend only so i can deploy it to netlify
yes and dont disturb my front end

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/index.html` boots the app from a new static-only entry file (e.g., a new `frontend/src/main.static.tsx`), so `frontend/src/main.tsx` remains untouched.
The running site no longer requires Internet Identity to initialize (no II login flow is needed and no II-related runtime initialization blocks rendering).
No calls to create/use an IC backend actor are required for any user-visible page to load and function as before (visually unchanged).

requirements.text: Update the Contact form so it does not attempt any backend/canister submission and remains visually unchanged; it must behave as a static frontend-only form (e.g., local-only submission handling with an on-screen success/failure message) while keeping all user-facing text in English.

quotes: Should I remove the contact formâ€™s backend submission logic and turn it into a static/non-functional form, or hide/remove the form entirely?

acceptanceCriteria: Submitting the contact form performs no backend/actor/canister request and does not require Internet Identity.
The Contact page renders the same form UI (fields and layout remain), and submission gives a clear in-app confirmation message in English.
The app builds and runs on Netlify with the Contact page usable without any backend.

requirements.text: Make the deployment Netlify-friendly for an SPA: add Netlify configuration and redirects so all routes (Home/About/Solutions/Contact and any deep links) load correctly on refresh and direct navigation.

quotes: ok make my project to frontend only so i can deploy it to netlify
make my code static and netlify freindly

acceptanceCriteria: A Netlify deploy configuration exists (e.g., `netlify.toml`) with the correct build command and publish directory for the Vite build output.
An SPA redirect rule exists (e.g., `frontend/public/_redirects` with `/* /index.html 200`) so deep links work on Netlify.
Refreshing any app route on Netlify returns the app (not a 404).

requirements.text: Keep the visible frontend UI/appearance unchanged while performing the frontend-only conversion (no intentional layout, styling, copy, or content changes except where necessary to remove backend-only functionality).

quotes: yes and dont disturb my front end

acceptanceCriteria: Header, footer, Home, About, Solutions, and Contact pages render with the same layout and styling as before the conversion.
Any user-facing text introduced or modified during the conversion remains in English.
No new authentication UI or backend-related UI is added.

constraints: Do not edit frontend immutable paths: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, and any files under `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
Backend must not be required for the deployed site to run (frontend-only runtime).
nonGoals: Adding new product features unrelated to the frontend-only conversion (e.g., new pages, new service content, new UI redesign).
Implementing third-party authentication (only removal/avoidance of Internet Identity is in scope).
Adding external databases or server-side APIs.
